name: Basic programmes and qualifications
description: Within Generic Programmes and Qualifications, Basic programmes and qualifications are designed to provide participants with fundamental skills in reading, writing, and arithmetic, along with an elementary understanding of other subjects such as history, geography, natural science, social science, art, and music. These programmes are normally offered at primary and lower secondary levels, but can include broad, non-specialised programmes at upper secondary level. [cite: 31, 32, 33]

name: Broad generic (non-specialised) programmes and qualifications
description: These are Basic programmes and qualifications that are broad and non-specialised, often found at the upper secondary level, providing a general education without a specific subject emphasis. [cite: 33]

name: General programmes and qualifications with no specific subject emphasis
description: Falling under Basic programmes and qualifications, these are general programmes typically at the primary or lower secondary level that do not focus on a particular subject area. [cite: 31, 32, 34]

name: Programmes and qualifications at primary level
description: These are Basic programmes and qualifications specifically delivered at the primary education level, focusing on fundamental skills and elementary understanding of various subjects. [cite: 31, 32, 34]
